results.title: The Lost World Jurassic Park [computer game]
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, cartridge case, consumer information booklet, Nintendo Power subscription form, registration card, poster and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Based on the movie of the same name, The Lost World: Jurassic Park is set on Isla Sorna, also known as “Site B”, where dinosaurs were created to populate the original park. As an agent for InGen, the player must recover eggs, DNA and key information on the cloning process before BioSyn, a rival company, gets their hands on it. Gameplay consists of running, jumping and climbing through the buildings, jungles and caves of the island. Getting in the player’s way are BioSyn thugs and a variety of dinosaurs, such as Pterodactyl, Triceratops and the eponymous Tyrannosaurus Rex. The player can defend himself by using kicks, punches and weapons, as well as ammo and health power-ups.

group_siblings.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure [computer game]
group_siblings.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box

results.title: The Lion King: Simba's Mighty Adventure [computer game]
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, plastic cartridge case, registration card, consumer information booklet and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Simba’s Mighty Adventure is based on Disney’s The Lion King as well as it’s direct-to-video sequel Simba’s Pride. The game consists of ten side-scrolling levels: The first six are set in The Lion King and the rest in Simba’s Pride, with some levels ending in boss fights. The game tracks along with the plot of both films and follows Simba as he grows up. Key events, such as the stampede from the first film, make up their own levels. Simba moves by running, jumping and climbing. Jumping can also be used to defeat the snakes, spiders, or monkeys that get in Simba’s way. He can also swipe at them with his claw or, as an adult, roar at them to make them flee.

Aiding Simba in his journey are collectibles that grant extra lives, refill or extend Simba’s health or fill a special amulet. Collecting all five parts of the amulet grants an extra life and opens up a mini-game that can be played main menu. The game also has a mulitplayer element. Using a Gameboy Colour link cable with another player opens up an extramode where each player has to hold onto a star for as long as possible by avoiding the opposing player’s attacks.

results.title: Play It Again II: Games Collection
results.brief_description:
The Play It Again II project aims to document, preserve, and create an accessible and playable history of Australasian videogames and videogame culture from the 1990’s.

This collection comprises physical games and hardware donated to ACMI for the project and as well as game emulation files created by ACMI or harvested from external web repositories.

The project is being undertaken by ACMI in partnership with Swinburne University, RMIT, AARNet, UNESCO PERSIST and OpenSLX GmbHt.
This project is supported by the Australian Government through the Australian Research Council Linkage Program. Play It Again II is a continuation of Play It Again I, which focused on the preservation of Australasian videogames from the 1980’s.

results.title: Krazy Ivan [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, manual and registration card in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
Aliens have invaded the earth, raised energy generators that are slowly engulfing the planet and have imprisoned humans in robots. The only person who can stop them is Russian Commander Ivan Popovich and his Steel Cossack, a battle-ready powersuit.

In this 3D first person arcade shooter, the player must destroy the five energy generators by defeating the aliens defending it while simultaneously freeing any humans in the process. Rescuing humans gives the player resources that can be used to upgrade the Steel Cossack.

results.title: KKND 2: Krush Kill 'N Destroy Krossfire [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and CD jewel case with insert
results.brief_description: The battle for Earth rages on in the bleak world of KKnD2: Krossfire. The Survivors and Mutes from the previous game are joined by a new enemy: the Series 9. The Series 9 are a robot faction with origins in farm machinery. The radiation from mankind’s wars has warped their programming and they’ve taken up arms against the two original factions, who have destroyed the crops that they were designed to care for. As with the prior games, this game’s focus is resource management, base building, researching upgrades and the creation of units to defeat the other factions.

results.title: International Cricket [computer game]
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, cartridge sleeve and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
International Cricket is one of the few NES titles released exclusively in Australia, as with Aussie Rules Footy. The game features eight teams; Australia, England, India, New Zealand, Pakistan, South Africa, Sri Lanka, and West Indies as well as a hidden team called The Beam Team, where each of the developers’ portraits is represented by Sonic the Hedgehog.

The game has several modes. In Fast Game, a team is randomly selected for the player and the computer. A Single Match is a regular exhibition game where the player chooses their both their and the computer opponent’s team. The game’s main mode is The World Series, where up to four players select a team and will then go up against the other opponenets. In the batting screen, the game is seen from a 3rd-person view, but after the ball is hit, the game switches to a birds-eye view. Whenever a certain event occurs, a cutscene is played to represent the event.

The game has several modes. In Fast Game, a team is randomly selected for the player and the computer. The game’s main mode is The World Series, where up to four players select a team and will then go up against the other opponenets. In the batting screen, the game is seen from a 3rd-person view, but after the ball is hit, the game switches to a birds-eye view. Whenever a certain event occurs, a cutscene is played to represent the event.

A Single Match is a regular exhibition game where the player chooses their both their and the computer opponent’s team. The game’s main mode is The World Series, where up to four players select a team and will then go up against the other opponenets. results.title: Enemy Infestation [computer game]
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM, CD jewel case, manual and registration in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
In the remote human colony on Redavi, an alien spaceship filled has crash-landed and creatures within have begun to mercilessly attack the colonists. Its only hope is a small squad of human defenders, their wits and whatever they can scavenge.

The game is set over 27 squad-based real time strategy missions with a large variety of tasks, ranging from rescuing fellow colonists to exterminating all the aliens. A unique feature is the overall mission structure, where the player has multiple missions to choose from. The game supports multiplayer up to 4 players on LAN and Internet and single player co-op.

results.title: Duke Nukem [computer game]
results.brief_description: Duke Nukem’s world-saving exploits have attracted the attention of a new alien foe, the Zorgonites. They plan kidnap the smartest minds in the universe - including Duke’s - to power their hyper-intelligent war machine and conquer the universe. The game takes the player around the world and beyond to stop this from happening. A Game Boy Colour port of Duke Nukem II, much as been changed. For instance, the Zorgonites were originally called the Rigelatins. The levels, weapons, items, enemies, and bosses are almost completely different.

They plan kidnap the smartest minds in the universe - including Duke’s - to power their hyper-intelligent war machine and conquer the universe. The game takes the player around the world and beyond to stop this from happening. A Game Boy Colour port of Duke Nukem II, much as been changed. For instance, the Zorgonites were originally called the Rigelatins. The levels, weapons, items, enemies, and bosses are almost completely different.
description_for_label: Duke Nukem’s world-saving exploits have attracted the attention of a new alien foe, the Zorgonites. They plan kidnap the smartest minds in the universe - including Duke’s - to power their hyper-intelligent war machine and conquer the universe. The game takes the player around the world and beyond to stop this from happening. A Game Boy Colour port of Duke Nukem II, much as been changed. For instance, the Zorgonites were originally called the Rigelatins. The levels, weapons, items, enemies, and bosses are almost completely different.

results.title: Dragonheart [computer game]
results.brief_description: Based on the 1996 fantasy film of the same name, the player is Bowen, a dragon slayer for hire, who journeys through eight levels exploring the land, defeating thieves, fighting dragons and encountering characters from the film. Exploration is presented in a 1st-person-view while battles are more akin to a fighting game. In addition, the player can get information about the current quest from peasants in the villages littered throughout the game.
results.description: Based on the 1996 fantasy film of the same name, the player is Bowen, a dragon slayer for hire, who journeys through eight levels exploring the land, defeating thieves, fighting dragons and encountering characters from the film. Exploration is presented in a 1st-person-view while battles are more akin to a fighting game. In addition, the player can get information about the current quest from peasants in the villages littered throughout the game.
description_for_label: Based on the 1996 fantasy film of the same name, the player is Bowen, a dragon slayer for hire, who journeys through eight levels exploring the land, defeating thieves, fighting dragons and encountering characters from the film. Exploration is presented in a 1st-person-view while battles are more akin to a fighting game. In addition, the player can get information about the current quest from peasants in the villages littered throughout the game.
